channel.title: Chemistry Homework
channel.description:
So, 3 weeks into Chemistry and I have a shit load of work I need to catch up on. Doing it all tonight and I'm about half way. Just stuck on two questions/Couldn't be fucked researching. :)
[hr]
Q16) [b]Propose[/b] how the following separations could be achieved : [b]a[/b] iron filings from an iron filings-charcoal mixture. [b]b[/b] sugar from a sugar solution. [b]c[/b] small amounts of insecticide from a fruit. [b]d[/b] oxygen from air. [b]e[/b] red bloods cells from blood plasma. [b]f[/b] water from sea water.
Q17) [b]Identify[/b] eight common but useful materials and [b]classify[/b] these as elements, compounds, homogeneous mixtures or heterogeneous mixtures. [b]Identify[/b] which of these materials are used in a naturally occurring form and which have been processed in some way.
[hr]
Any help is appreciated. With Q16, things like Crystallisation, Chromatography, Distillation, Sieving and so on are the methods that I need to answer in. With Q17, I already have 6, but I'm not quite sure If I did it right. So, explanations would be great. Moving onto my Physics homework while I wait, ahh.

@XxKanexX wrote:

So, 3 weeks into Chemistry and I have a shit load of work I need to catch up on.
Doing it all tonight and I’m about half way.
Just stuck on two questions/Couldn’t be fucked researching.

Q16) Propose how the following separations could be achieved :
a iron filings from an iron filings-charcoal mixture.
b sugar from a sugar solution.
c small amounts of insecticide from a fruit.
d oxygen from air.
e red bloods cells from blood plasma.
f water from sea water.

Q17) Identify eight common but useful materials and classify these as elements, compounds, homogeneous mixtures or heterogeneous mixtures. Identify which of these materials are used in a naturally occurring form and which have been processed in some way.

[hr]

Any help is appreciated.
With Q16, things like Crystallisation, Chromatography, Distillation, Sieving and so on are the methods that I need to answer in.
With Q17, I already have 6, but I’m not quite sure If I did it right. So, explanations would be great.
